title: 107_hr4155
content: The Act titled "District of Columbia Legislative Autonomy Act of 2002" eliminates congressional review of newly-passed District laws. The District of Columbia Home Rule Act is amended to remove congressional resolutions of disapproval and the exercise of rulemaking power by Congress. The District of Columbia Home Rule Act is amended to allow either House to change rules relating to that House in the same manner as any other rule. SEC. 3. CONFORMING AMENDMENTS. The District of Columbia Home Rule Act is being amended in various sections, including changes to subsections and the removal of certain sentences. These changes aim to clarify and update the provisions of the Act. Section 475(e) of the District of Columbia Home Rule Act is amended to exclude certain payments from the fourth sentence of section 446. Additionally, various amendments are made to Amendment No. 1 regarding initiative and referendum procedures in the District Charter. Amendments are made to section 475(e) of the District of Columbia Home Rule Act, excluding certain payments and making changes to Amendment No. 1 on initiative and referendum procedures in the District Charter. The amendments made by this Act apply to acts of the District of Columbia passed on or after October 1, 2002, including those signed by the Mayor, vetoed and repassed by the Council, allowed to become effective without the Mayor's signature, or ratified by a majority of registered qualified electors.
